## Developer Guide

If you are new to using `nbdev` here are some useful pointers to get you
started.

### Install kplot in Development mode

``` sh
# make sure kplot package is installed in development mode
$ pip install -e .

# make changes under nbs/ directory
# ...

# compile to have changes apply to kplot
$ nbdev_prepare
```

## Usage

### Installation

Install latest from the GitHub
[repository](https://github.com/sky1ove/kplot):

``` sh
$ pip install git+https://github.com/sky1ove/kplot.git
```

or from [conda](https://anaconda.org/sky1ove/kplot)

``` sh
$ conda install -c sky1ove kplot
```

or from [pypi](https://pypi.org/project/kplot/)

``` sh
$ pip install kplot
```

### Documentation

Documentation can be found hosted on this GitHub
[repository](https://github.com/sky1ove/kplot)’s
[pages](https://sky1ove.github.io/kplot/). Additionally you can find
package manager specific guidelines on
[conda](https://anaconda.org/sky1ove/kplot) and
[pypi](https://pypi.org/project/kplot/) respectively.
